summary: The FinOps Specialist course offered by בית הספר להייטק וסייבר at אוניברסיטת בר אילן is designed to prepare finance professionals for careers in cloud environments. The course covers a range of topics including AWS Cloud basics, architectural principles, key services, security and compliance, cloud pricing and billing, and FinOps tools and practices. Participants will learn about AWS cost management, cloud cost monitoring, and best practices for success. The course is delivered in a hybrid format, allowing students to attend classes on campus or via Zoom.
full_text:
COURSE NAME: FinOps Specialist

COURSE OVERVIEW: The FinOps Specialist course at Bar-Ilan University's School of High-Tech and Cyber invites you to develop your next career in the financial world of cloud computing.

COURSE SCHEDULE: The course starts on January 31, 2025. Classes are held on Tuesdays from 17:30 to 21:30 and on Fridays from 09:00 to 13:00. The course consists of 8 sessions, totaling 40 academic hours.

LEARNING FORMAT: The course is hybrid, with classes conducted both on the Bar-Ilan campus in Ramat Gan and via Zoom, according to your preference.

COURSE TOPICS: The course covers a wide range of topics, including:
- Defining what the AWS Cloud is and its basic global infrastructure.
- Describing basic AWS Cloud architectural principles.
- Understanding the AWS Cloud value proposition.
- Identifying key services on the AWS platform and their common use cases, such as compute and analytics.
- Exploring basic security and compliance aspects of the AWS platform and the shared security model.
- Identifying sources of documentation or technical assistance.
- Describing basic/core characteristics of deploying and operating in the AWS Cloud.
- Reviewing cloud concepts and overall understanding.
- Exploring main cloud services.
- Understanding FinOps, its importance, and necessity.
- Learning about cloud pricing and billing.
- Exploring finance tools and options, including commitments and agreements.
- Introduction to AWS cost explorer.
- Engaging in use cases and brainstorming sessions.
- Learning cost control techniques, including tags, alerts, and budgeting.
- Introduction to K8S, high-level technical review, and FinOps point of view.
- Exploring FinOps third-party tools and products.
- Monitoring cloud costs.
- Tips for success and best practices.
- Final exam/exercise based on AWS Cost Explorer.

REGISTRATION AND CONTACT INFORMATION: To schedule an admission interview and register, contact Esther Asulin at 052-5886002 or esther.asulin@biu.ac.il.
